item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:

2. Mitochondria Are Alive (450 points | 304 comments)
3. 'Smart' insulin prevents diabetic highs – and deadly lows (48 points | 12 comments)
4. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (123 points | 38 comments)

21. Zep AI (YC W24) Is Hiring DevRel / Community Managers to Build Agent Memory ( | hide)
22. It's legal for police to use deception in interrogations. Some want that to end (179 points | 144 comments)
23. Algol-68 seemed like a good idea – until it wasn't (38 points | 25 comments)
24. Why 4D geometry makes me sad [video] (56 points | 23 comments)
25. Apple Macintosh before System 7 (84 points | 64 comments)
26. LoRA vs. Full Fine-Tuning: An Illusion of Equivalence (199 points | 47 comments)
27. Neural Optical Flow for PIV in Fluids (9 points | 2 comments)
28. Claude Shannon: Mathematician, engineer, genius and juggler (2017) (139 points | 50 comments)
29. What Is a Staff Engineer? (93 points | 84 comments)
30. The evolution of nepotism in academia, 1088-1800 (76 points | 90 comments)
